teaser: New research has found a link between Google search terms and the stock market. In other words, check out what people are searching for and then buy or sell.
contentencoded:
New research has found a link between Google search terms and the stock market. In other words, check out what people are searching for and then buy or sell. In particular, watch for the terms "debt", "portfolio" and "stocks". As searches for those words went up, the Dow Jones went down and vice versa.

Tobias Preis, one of the researchers at Warwick Business School in the UK who conducted the study, joins Marketplace Morning Report host Jeremy Hobson to explain.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Friday, April 26, 2013

title: What Google search can tell you about the stock market
description: New research has found a link between Google search terms and the stock market. In other words, check out what people are searching for and then buy or sell.
